alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 24 at 8:16AM EDT until April 02 at 10:40PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Indiana, including the following counties, Brown and Monroe. * WHEN...Until 115 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 813 AM EDT, gauge reports indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring in North Fork Salt Creek at Nashville. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - North Fork Salt Creek at Nashville is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Bloomington, Nashville, Ellettsville, Woodville Hills, Yellowwood Lake, Unionville, Charles Deam Wilderness, Monroe Reservoir, Lake Lemon, Elkinsville, Helmsburg, Smithville, Indiana University, Story, Fairfax State Recreation Area, Whitehall, Harrodsburg, Stone Head, Gnaw Bone and Spurgeons Corner. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
